thing-type.label: Pingable Network Device
thing-type.description: The presence detection is performed by using ICMP and, if available, ARP pings. You can change the arping tool path in the binding configuration. DHCP sniffing is performed for faster network reentry discovery.

parameter.name: hostname
parameter.label: Hostname or IP
parameter.description: Hostname or IP of the device

parameter.name: macAddress
parameter.label: MAC Address
parameter.description: MAC address used for waking the device by the Wake-on-LAN action

parameter.name: refreshInterval
parameter.label: Refresh Interval
parameter.description: States how long to wait after a device state update before the next refresh shall occur (in ms)

parameter.name: retry
parameter.label: Retry
parameter.description: How many refresh interval cycles should a presence detection should take place, before the device is stated as offline

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.label: Timeout
parameter.description: States how long to wait for a response (in ms), before if a device is stated as offline

parameter.name: networkInterfaceNames
parameter.label: Network Interface Names
parameter.description: The network interface names used for communicating with the device. Limiting the network interfaces reduces the load when arping and Wake-on-LAN are used. All interfaces are used when left empty.

parameter.name: useIOSWakeUp
parameter.label: Use iOS Wake Up
parameter.description: Set to true if the device presence detection should be performed for an iOS device like iPhone or iPads. An additional port knock is performed before a ping.

thing-type.label: Network Device with Running Service
thing-type.description: A device which reachable state is detected by connecting to a TCP port. DHCP sniffing is performed for faster network reentry discovery.

parameter.name: hostname
parameter.label: Hostname or IP
parameter.description: Hostname or IP of the device

parameter.name: port
parameter.label: Port
parameter.description: The port on which the device can be accessed. Windows systems usually have the 445 port open. Webservers are on port 80.

parameter.name: macAddress
parameter.label: MAC Address
parameter.description: MAC address used for waking the device by the Wake-on-LAN action

parameter.name: retry
parameter.label: Retry
parameter.description: Defines how many times a connection attempt shall occur, before the device is stated as offline

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.label: Timeout
parameter.description: States how long to wait for a response (in ms), before if a device is stated as offline

parameter.name: refreshInterval
parameter.label: Refresh Interval
parameter.description: States how long to wait after a device state update before the next refresh shall occur (in ms)

parameter.name: networkInterfaceNames
parameter.label: Network Interface Names
parameter.description: The network interface names used for communicating with the device. Limiting the network interfaces reduces the load when arping and Wake-on-LAN are used. All interfaces are used when left empty.

parameter.name: refreshInterval
parameter.label: Refresh Time Interval
parameter.description: Refresh time interval in minutes.

parameter.name: initialDelay
parameter.label: Initial Delay
parameter.description: Delay before starting the first speed test (minutes) after initialization of the binding.

parameter.name: uploadSize
parameter.label: Upload Size
parameter.description: Size of the file to be uploaded (bytes).

parameter.name: url
parameter.label: Test Server URL
parameter.description: Url of the speed test server

parameter.name: fileName
parameter.label: File Name
parameter.description: Name of the file to download from test server

parameter.name: maxTimeout
parameter.label: Timeouts
parameter.description: Number of timeout that can happend before the device is stated as offline

channel-type.label: Test Running
channel-type.description: Indicates if a test is currently ongoing

channel-type.label: Online
channel-type.description: States whether a device is online or offline
